LOL, thanks!!!


  ----- Original Message ----- 
  From: joel smith<mailto:=
sparky1j41@...> 
  To: EVP-ITC@yahoogroups.com<mailto:EVP-ITC@yahoogr=
oups.com> 
  Sent: Saturday, January 05, 2008 9:35 PM
  Subject: Re: [EVP-I=
TC] Check out what I broke this time


  if you send it to me i'll fix it  =
but you need to be ready to rock and roll when get it back to you 

  Robin=
 Henson <MudPuddleFarm@...<mailto:MudPuddleFarm@...>> wrote: 

    =
After viewing Mike's RS 12-469 hack video for the fifth time I felt 
    re=
ady to take the plunge myself, so yesterday while dh was picking up 
    a =
pizza at Papa John's I sneaked next door and bought the radio. He 
    coul=
dn't stop complaining about how I'd wasted money on a perfectly 
    good p=
iece of equipment only to wreck it for my dumb hobby, but once 
    we got =
home he took it upon himself to test it and make sure it 
    worked. For s=
ome reason it really DIDN'T work, so he took it back to 
    RS and exchang=
ed it for another one, and after making sure THAT one 
    worked he even o=
ffered to help me with the modification. "No thanks" 
    I told him. "I th=
ink I need to do this myself." 

    I can't pretend the process went as sm=
oothly as I'd hoped, but 
    finally I was done and making the last turn i=
n the second screw of 
    the circuit board.. and then.. The whole thing f=
lew out of my hands 
    and both battery wires ripped away from their sold=
ered ends in the 
    casing. It was all Bob could do to keep from gleefull=
y yelling "I 
    knew you were going to break it!" But then I guess he fel=
t bad 
    because he ran down to Walmart and got a soldering iron and sold=
er 
    and spent an hour trying to put it all back together for me. 

    =
It's dead as a doornail, and I'm thinking that if I could break it 
    tha=
t easily without even knowing how or why, maybe I'm not supposed 
    to pu=
rsue this method (sigh). I guess I'll just think it over and 
    maybe try=
 again later. 

    Thanks for all the helpful information though Mike!

  =
  Robin
